page.title: 03House Building Techniques
page.content: We found out how a house is built. The architect draws up the plans, and then the quantity surveyor works out what materials are needed and what it will all cost. The plans are given to the builder who marks out the site with wooden pegs and tape. The top soil is taken away, trenches are dug and the foundations are laid using concrete. Now there are new methods of building: Wimpey build the inside walls of wood and put in doors and windows.Then they put on the roof. Last they build up the outside walls. Cranbrook build in the traditional way and build the outside walls first and put the roof on last. The newer method is much cheaper. All the new houses have wooden windows and doors. In any one street there are different sizes of houses and different styles. Most of the houses are built of reconstituted stone with some of brick.
